message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the properties of talc and its interaction with surfaces. When a piece of talc is rolled over a black chalkboard, it leaves a streak of white residue behind. This is because talc is a soft mineral that can leave a mark on surfaces when it comes in contact with them. Option (A) is incorrect because talc does not burn the board. Option (B) is incorrect because talc does not have absorbent properties like a spill-wiping material. Option (D) is incorrect because talc is not hard enough to make a dent in the chalkboard.

Option (A) is incorrect because talc does not burn the board. Option (B) is incorrect because talc does not act as a cleaning agent. Option (D) is incorrect because talc is a soft mineral that cannot make a dent in a chalkboard.
